Articles.Content:
can someone upload a good launch vehicle for the pieces?

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/asterisk-super-heavy-lifter-stock/

That's an all stock launcher that will put 150tons into LKO reliably every launch. I use it myself for heavy lifting, be warned it is kinda high part count, but a good launch vehicle for being all stock.

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/asterisk-super-heavy-lifter-stock/

That's an all stock launcher that will put 150tons into LKO reliably every launch. I use it myself for heavy lifting, be warned it is kinda high part count, but a good launch vehicle for being all stock.

what is your method of landing it with that?

what is your method of landing it with that?

I'm guessing insanely carefully!

Looks brilliant!

How stable is it? Looks like it gets pretty small.

Its pretty stable, it would be very very hard to tip over

I would guess its roughly 5-6 meters across when fully deployed, I'm not sure that this is going to be the final size and i may tweak the size of it to make it slightly bigger.

the screenshot below shows it twice its original size, what do you guys think?

Kerbal added for size comparison :
This is one of the things I think "bigger is better" applies to. Except maybe when you are trying to get it into space.

Its pretty stable, it would be very very hard to tip over

I would guess its roughly 5-6 meters across when fully deployed, I'm not sure that this is going to be the final size and i may tweak the size of it to make it slightly bigger.

the screenshot below shows it twice its original size, what do you guys think?

Kerbal added for size comparison :

It looks good that big, but how small does it fold up into? Also how can it attach/be attached to?

Big is usually better, but only if ya have so much flat ground to land it on.

It looks good that big, but how small does it fold up into? Also how can it attach/be attached to?

Big is usually better, but only if ya have so much flat ground to land it on.

here it is folded up, it will have connection node on the bottom of it for connection to a two meter tank. it will also have its own internal engines and fuel so you will be able to land it by itself
Looking good germalto, can't wait to try it out.

here it is folded up, it will have connection node on the bottom of it for connection to a two meter tank. it will also have its own internal engines and fuel so you will be able to land it by itself

I was waiting for MagicSmoke Ind to release the slidding rails to reattemt my laythe base......I may have to wait for this too =)

Lookin good, its big, but not to big it has to go on somewhat even ground.

Everything should work in 0.21, post about any bugs you encounter.

We're working on the next release Sorry for the time since the last update.

Everything should work in 0.21, post about any bugs you encounter.

We're working on the next release Sorry for the time since the last update.

Good to hear, I really enjoy these modules.

Cheers
Really looking forward to the full pack, started anew with the update and want my new bases to be MMM

This is kinda a bump, but how much of this works with 0.21.1? Also any idea of when an update may be for this? >.> I only finally found this after searching for a while

Eep, only just saw the thing saying it should work fine with 0.21.

Edited July 28, 2013 by Ryusho
Gonna give this a slight bump. Loving these parts, can't wait to get some more tasty ones to play around with
If you like internal EVAs, check out http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/29031-Hollow-Structure-Hulls for more hollow parts.

If you like internal EVAs, check out http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/29031-Hollow-Structure-Hulls for more hollow parts.

Ahah... I love this mod, too! It's really nice, and very well done

I've got something to show you all...

This mod is amazing! This mod is very unique, I only know this and two other mods that add internal EVA parts but for some reason this one is the better of the two. I cannot wait for more updates for this simple, but very outstanding mod I hope all progress is going smoothly and I hope to see more updates soon!

Awesome mod to see. I've been waiting for this feature in Lack Luster Labs but seeing this mod was made for it i instantly downloaded it. I encountered a lighting bug (shadows were all over the place) 5 min ago but cannot seem to recreate it so i'll shut my mouth untill i see it more often. Great work so far anyways

*edit*

here it is again http://cloud-2.steampowered.com/ugc/597018368788476751/3D23F937E1CDEF85E14CA2815EBEE168146702FF/

when moving the camera the shadows flicker non stop at like 40 flickers / second. it's quite distracting and obviously not ment to happen, any idears on how to fix this?

*edit*

My game crashed 2 times after some inactivity. might be something else causing this but haven't seen it before using this mod. Still not hating or something, but if there's a solution, i'd welcome it ^^

Edited October 28, 2013 by Scarking

What ever happened to this effort? I see a whole bunch of partially completed structures in this thread that I would LOVE to add to my bases.

GREAT add-on and I hope that more content will be created and released! PS: I also asked this question at the spaceport as well. I REALLY like this add-on and hope that it has not been dropped...

Yeah...i suppose it's kinda been dropped. I've been really busy IRL and haven't had the chance to get back to this. i might re-start it during the beginning of april as i have some time off then to do it.
I think this mod may be updated in the near future, actually... I have some free time, and I'd be happy to continue working on this.
Sweet bump op *)
You could also use Bavarian Tubes.

I think this mod may be updated in the near future, actually... I have some free time, and I'd be happy to continue working on this.

That would be totally awesome! I really enjoy this mod and would love to see it being enhanced with more base structures. Great work and THANKS!

You could also use Bavarian Tubes.

Yes, one could also use Bavarian Tubes, I find them really nice, and they're actually pretty. But our mod is nice, too.

I just find Bavarian's to be a bit small... To each their own, I suppose.
